info.title: Renku Data Services API
info.description:
This service is the main backend for Renku. It provides information about users, projects,
cloud storage, access to compute resources and many other things.

200.description: The resource class that was requested

404.description: The resource class does not exist

200.description: The cluster configurations
The cluster configuration

404.description: The cluster configuration does not exist

200.description: The cluster configuration

404.description: The cluster configuration does not exist

200.description: The cluster configuration

404.description: The cluster configuration does not exist

204.description: The cluster configuration was removed or did not exist in the first place

parameters.description: Filter for resource classes based on the provided name as a prefix. Omitting this parameter returns all classes.

404.description: The resource pool does not exist

204.description: The resource class was removed or did not exist in the first place

get.summary: Get the tolerations from a resource class

get.summary: Get all users that have access to a resource pool

201.description: The list of users was updated

404.description: The resource pool does not exist

200.description: The list of users was updated

404.description: The resource pool does not exist

get.summary: Check if a specific user belongs to a specific resource pool

200.description: The user belongs to the resource pool

404.description: The user does not belong to the resource pool, or the resource pool or user do not exist

delete.summary: Remove a specific user from a specific resource pool

204.description: The user was removed or it was not part of the pool

404.description: The resource pool does not exist

200.description: The quota has been updated

404.description: The resource pool does not exist

get.summary: Get all resource pools that the user has access to

parameters.description: Filter for resource classes based on the provided name as a prefix. Omitting this parameter returns all classes.
parameters.name: user_resource_params

200.description: The resource pools that the user has access to

404.description: The user does not exist

post.summary: Give the user access to the specified resource pools

201.description: The resource pools that the user has been given access to

404.description: The user or resource pool(s) do not exist

put.summary: Set the list of resource pools that the user has access to

200.description: The resource pools that the user has been given access to

404.description: The user or resource pool(s) do not exist

get.summary: Get the version of the service

200.description: The error

no_default_access.description: If set to true the user will not be able to use the default resource pool
If set to true the user will not be able to use the default resource pool
If set to true the user will not be able to use the default resource pool

IntegerId.description: An integer ID used to identify different resources

Name.description: A name for a specific resource

ConfigName.description:
The name of the Kubernetes configuration to use to connect to the remote cluster. This is currently used to find a file named `<KubeConfigRoot>/<config_name>`.

This configuration is expected to have a default namespace defined. It will be used for all remote operations requiring a namespace, as well for namespaced objects.

DefaultFlag.description: A default selection for resource classes or resource pools

DefaultFlagPatch.description: A default selection for resource classes or resource pools

PublicFlag.description: A resource pool whose classes can be accessed by anyone

PublicFlagPatch.description: A resource pool whose classes can be accessed by anyone

RemoteConfiguration.description:
The configuration used by Renku to start sessions remotely.
If this field is present, the corresponding resource pool starts remote sessions.

RemoteConfigurationFirecrest.description:
The configuration for starting sessions remotely using
the FirecREST API

RemoteConfigurationFirecrestProviderId.description:
The ID of a provider (see oauth2 section).
This is used to allow seamless authentication using Renku integrations.

RemoteConfigurationFirecrestApiUrl.description: The base URL of the FirecREST API

RemoteConfigurationFirecrestSystemName.description: The name of the system to use with the FirecREST API

RemoteConfigurationFirecrestPartition.description: The partition to use when submitting jobs

RemoteConfigurationPatch.description: Patch for the configuration used by to start sessions remotely

RemoteConfigurationPatchReset.description: Value used to unset the remote field (empty object).

RemoteConfigurationFirecrestPatch.description:
The configuration for starting sessions remotely using
the FirecREST API

IdleThreshold.description: A threshold in seconds after which a session gets hibernated (0 means no threshold)

HibernationThreshold.description: A threshold in seconds after which a session gets culled/deleted (0 means no threshold)

K8sLabelList.description: A list of k8s labels used for tolerations

K8sResourceName.description:
A name of any K8s resource (i.e. Pod, Service, Secret, etc.).
This is pattern imposes the stricter rules applied to some resource type names
that need to follow DNS label standard and therefore can be used for all types.
Looser rules can be applied to a smaller subset of resource types.

K8sResourceNamePatch.description:
A name of any K8s resource (i.e. Pod, Service, Secret, etc.).
This is pattern imposes the stricter rules applied to some resource type names
that need to follow DNS label standard and therefore can be used for all types.
Looser rules can be applied to a smaller subset of resource types. An empty
string indicates that the value should be removed if present in the DB.

NodeAffinity.description: A minimal representation of a node affinity label

NodeAffinityListResponse.description: A list of k8s labels used for tolerations and/or node affinity

NodeAffinityList.description: A list of k8s labels used for tolerations and/or node affinity

detail.example: A more detailed optional message showing what the problem was

message.example: Something went wrong - please try again later

Error.description: The schema for all 4xx and 5xx responses
